TopicTitle: Ground Track or Ground Trace Add-on

Articles.Content:
I came here to ask of one thing; A ground track add-on. Somebody was working on this a long time ago, I'm not really sure what happened to him. 

I feel like this would really come in handy for timing launches to rendezvous with stations in an inclined orbit, like the ISS (51.6 degrees). Please let me know what you think ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

![r16UTKF.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/r16UTKF.jpg)
[SCANsat](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/80369-0-90-SCANsat-v8-1-Real-Scanning-Real-Science-at-Warp-Speed%21-Dec-19) does this, along with mapping function.

Think he might be talking about Telemachus [http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/24594-0-23-Telemachus-%E2%80%93-Telemetry-and-Flight-Control-in-the-Web-Browser-%282014-1-11%29](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/24594-0-23-Telemachus-%E2%80%93-Telemetry-and-Flight-Control-in-the-Web-Browser-%282014-1-11%29) And there was this [http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/75986-Using-NASA-Mission-Control-Software-with-KSP](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/75986-Using-NASA-Mission-Control-Software-with-KSP) but the same guy.

> 
> [SCANsat](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/80369-0-90-SCANsat-v8-1-Real-Scanning-Real-Science-at-Warp-Speed%21-Dec-19) does this, along with mapping function.

Correct me if I'm wrong, but doesn't SCANsat only map the ground underneath your orbit? I'm fairly certain it doesn't trace the path of your current orbit or future orbit(s) over a full map of Kerbin.

> 
> Think he might be talking about Telemachus [http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/24594-0-23-Telemachus-%E2%80%93-Telemetry-and-Flight-Control-in-the-Web-Browser-%282014-1-11%29](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/24594-0-23-Telemachus-%E2%80%93-Telemetry-and-Flight-Control-in-the-Web-Browser-%282014-1-11%29) And there was this [http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/75986-Using-NASA-Mission-Control-Software-with-KSP](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/75986-Using-NASA-Mission-Control-Software-with-KSP) but the same guy.

I am well aware of Telemachus and I am quite fond of it. The thing is, it doesn't trace the path of your orbit. It only shows where your vessel is located over land.
ScanSat does track your orbit you can toggle it off and on and think it's only on the big map.
I will check that out, thanks.
